text:
Did you already give your feedback and wondering what to do?
Here is an *<https://www.codewars.com/kata/5ce9c1000bab0b001134f5af/train/python|easy kata>* to keep you busy :v:

Task:
*Input*: number from 1 to 12 for the month
*Output*: number from 1 to 4 for the quarter corresponding to the given month

attachments.title: Training on Quarter of the year | Codewars
attachments.text: Codewars is where developers achieve code mastery through challenge. Train on kata in the dojo and reach your highest potential.

elements.text:
Did you already give your feedback and wondering what to do?
Here is an
: number from 1 to 12 for the month
: number from 1 to 4 for the quarter corresponding to the given month

text: As always, share your solutions here:

elements.text: As always, share your solutions here:

text:
`if month in range(1,4):`
        `return 1`
    `elif month in range(4,7):`
        `return 2`
    `elif month in range (7,10):`
        `return 3`
    `elif month in range (9,13):`
        `return 4`
<@U01S1CWGTU4>, thanks for sharing! You can simplify the code more, there is a redundancy: the `elif` only activates `if` if is *False*, check this out:

elements.text: , thanks for sharing! You can simplify the code more, there is a redundancy: the

text:
`def quarter_of(month):`
    `if month <= 3:`
        `return 1`
    `elif month <= 6:`
        `return 2`
    `elif month <= 9:`
        `return 3`
    `else:`
        `return 4`
